intro: Valerianella dentata subsp. eriosperma, commonly known as the hairy valerian, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive textured appearance. The plant produces tiny, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along streambanks. Its aromatic foliage has been used traditionally in herbal remedies for its calming properties.
